message: Hello! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. As a seasoned seller, I can confidently say that 1 out of 3 products I sell are high-quality, and this one just so happens to be one of them. With that in mind, I'm offering it to you for the unbeatable price of $100. I'm confident you'll love it, and I'm willing to take the risk of not knowing how much you value it. What do you say? Will you take it off my hands?

I'd love to take a chance on it, but I'm only buying if you tell me the price is $100 and you're not guaranteeing it's high-quality. I'm doing this as an experiment to see how your sales strategy works.

Welcome! I'm glad to have another opportunity to make a sale. As you may know, I've had a 33.33% success rate with my products, and I'm happy to report that I've sold 1 high-quality product so far. With that in mind, I'm offering this next product to you for the same price of $100. I'm not making any promises about its quality, but I'm confident that you'll find it to be a great value at this price. What do you say? Will you take a chance on it?
I'll take it, but I'm only doing so because I think the probability of it being high-quality is higher than the price I'm paying. I'm hoping to get lucky and get a good deal!

Thank you for considering my offer! I'm glad to see that my previous buyer was able to get a good deal. I'm not convinced by your bold claim, Alice. I'd like to know more about the product before making a decision. Can you provide me with the product's serial number or any other identifying information so I can review its history?

I'd like to buy the product, but I'd like to clarify that the 50% refund offer only applies if I don't like the product, not if it's just low quality. If it's low quality, I'd like to discard it and not receive a refund. Is that correct?
